segments.text: I can’t help but chuckle softly as I see the boy struggle to balance on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, there’s a nagging sense of dread in my chest, knowing how easily he could get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman remains blissfully unaware, her attention solely on the plate she’s drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t she hear the water splashing onto the floor?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window casts a warm glow, almost mocking the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl standing there, captivated by the sight of cookies, her arm reaching up expectantly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s hard to be mad at them; their innocence is enchanting, yet it’s so misguided.
segments.speaker: PAR
